justification: The authors state: “We used the Polish version of the Pure Procrastination Scale… Both scales had excellent reliability,” indicating that procrastination was operationalised with this instrument.

measured_by: Dependent style subscale of the General Decision-Making Style Inventory (GDMS)
justification: The procedure notes that they used “the translation of the dependent style subscale from the GDMS (Scott & Bruce, 1995)” to assess the dependent decision-making style.
For the self-control construct the paper reports: “We used five items from the Brief Self-Control Scale and four items from the Short-Term Future Orientation Scale to measure self-control.”
The replication study states: “we also used the first 12 items from FMBS to measure financial behaviors,” linking this construct to the Financial Management Behavior Scale.
In the anchoring replication the authors write: “we used a Polish version of the TIPI scale as a measure of openness-to-experience,” showing the construct’s measurement instrument.
The numeracy study reports: “Participants completed a subjective numeracy test,” indicating that subjective numeracy was gauged with a dedicated subjective numeracy instrument.
